intro: Reseda alba var. trigyna, commonly known as white sweet rocket, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, clustered flowers and upright growth habit. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are white or pale pink, with four petals arranged in a cross shape, typical of the mustard family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed areas.
